content: day of the dead sugar skull earring pattern materials 2 skeins embroidery floss #3 hook 4 7mm beads large eye tapestry needle needle and thread 2 earring wires needle nose pliers size 1½ by 2 inches abbreviations chain/ chain slip_stitch/ slip st single_crochet/ single_crochet double_crochet/ double_crochet treble_crochet/ triple crochet skip/ skip x/ times round 1 eyes chain 7 join with a slip_stitch in first chain to form ring chain 1 work 14 single_crochet around ring chain 7 join with a slip_stitch at base of chain work 14 single_crochet around second chain join with a slip_stitch around st between eyes chain 3 do not turn forehead row 1 working along the left eye skip 3 sts single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn row 2 working around sts in space between eyes treble_crochet chain 1 4 times skip 3 sts on next eye slip_stitch in next end off cheeks and nose right side facing join yarn with a slip_stitch in bottom center single_crochet of eye chain 3 sl in center st of next eye chain 4 turn teeth double_crochet in first chain space chain 1 double_crochet in next chain chain 1 double_crochet in last chain chain 1 do not turn edging working up the side of the last tooth work 2 single_crochet around bar of double_crochet work 1 single_crochet around space of nose 1 single_crochet in each st of eye 2 single_crochet in each chain 1 space of forehead continue down the other side work 1 single_crochet in each st of eye a single_crochet around space of nose 4 single_crochet around 1st tooth 2 single_crochet in next two teeth join with a slip_stitch in first single_crochet end off working single_crochet around space of nose finishing run in loose ends with a tapestry needle sew bead in each eye socket from the wrong side so that you can hide knots bend loop on earring just a tiny bit side ways thread through center top stitch check to see that earring hangs evenly you may have to move the earring wire to a stitch so that the skull will balance close wire
